correctAnswer: "It’s the sense of touch. In any real city, you walk, you know? You brush past people, people bump into you. In L.A., nobody touches you. We’re always behind this metal and glass. I think we miss that touch so much, that we crash into each other, just so we can feel something."
incorrectAnswers: "What is this? A center for ants? How can we be expected to teach children to learn how to read…if they can’t even fit inside the building?"
